A

act(long) - Method in interface actor.Act
The method which implements what action the actor should do each frame.
act(long) - Method in class actor.panning.PanningActor
Defines what the actor should do each frame, this is abstracted out, when an actor moves off screen then move the actor back to the opposite side of the screen.
act(long) - Method in class actor.panning.Turtle
Defines the action of the object carries out, every number of frames it will cycle through the animations frames in the array.
act(long) - Method in class actor.player.deathcontroller.DeathController
Defines what the player should be doing each frame, if the state is null then it is not dying Else it is dying in which case get the animation for that specific death.
act(long) - Method in class actor.player.Player
The main act method, which checks every frame the frog is still within the screen, has been hit by a car, has sunken or is at the end of the game.
Act - Interface in actor
Created an interface for the Actors which need the Act method, as not all classes that implement Actor need Act.
activated - Variable in class actor.End
 
actor - package actor
 
Actor - Class in actor
The Actor class is used to define any sprite in the program, for example the player and obstacles.
Actor() - Constructor for class actor.Actor
 
actor.panning - package actor.panning
 
actor.player - package actor.player
 
actor.player.deathcontroller - package actor.player.deathcontroller
 
actor.player.walkingcontroller - package actor.player.walkingcontroller
 
add(Actor) - Method in class application.World
Adds a new actor to the window
addNewScore(String, int) - Method in class application.scoreboard.ScoreBoardModel
Lets you add a new score to the score board, this will then re-order the list based upon score to ensure it is Positioned it the correct place.
animationFrame - Variable in class actor.player.deathcontroller.DeathController
 
animationFrame - Variable in class actor.player.walkingcontroller.WalkingController
 
application - package application
 
application.scoreboard - package application.scoreboard
